content:
• Friday, December 23, 2011
  • AAPL

    The week was good to Apple (AAPL +1.2%), which closed back above $400 today for the first time...

    The week was good to Apple (AAPL +1.2%), which closed back above $400 today for the first time since Nov. 8. But the stock has gained little ground in its running battle with Exxon Mobil (XOM +1.1%) for the market cap championship, as the rise in crude prices has pushed the oil giant a similar ~6% this week. The latest market cap score: XOM $408.5B, AAPL $374.8B.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:57 PM | 1 Comment
  • MCD

    McDonald's (MCD +1.6%) closes above $100 for the first time, capping its Dow-leading 30% YTD...

    McDonald's (MCD +1.6%) closes above $100 for the first time, capping its Dow-leading 30% YTD gain. Global and same-store sales have been regularly beating expectations, but a 2012 repeat could prove difficult as MCD pushes further in emerging markets coping with inflationary pressures that could weigh on sales and margins.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:23 PM | 3 Comments
  • PERF

    Retailer Perfumania (NASDAQ:PERF) is acquiring perfume maker and trading partner Parlux...

    Retailer Perfumania (NASDAQ:PERF) is acquiring perfume maker and trading partner Parlux Fragrances (NASDAQ:PARL) for roughly $170M in cash and stock. Based on Perfumania's Thursday close, the deal values Parlux shares between $7.91/share and $8.55/share (depending on the outcome of shareholder elections) - a 127%-146% premium to what Parlux was trading at before shares were halted. Perfumania shares are also halted.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:02 PM
  • MJN

    More retailers pull Enfamil (MJN -5.2%) powdered infant formula from their shelves, joining...

    More retailers pull Enfamil (MJN -5.2%) powdered infant formula from their shelves, joining Wal-Mart's action yesterday. Supervalu (NYSE:SVU), Walgreen (WAG), Kroger (NYSE:KR) and Safeway (NYSE:SWY) say they have removed cans of Enfamil Newborn with the lot number ZP1K7G from U.S. stores as a precaution until health officials complete tests on the formula. (also)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:53 PM | 1 Comment
  • ONXX

    Onyx Pharmaceuticals (ONXX +4.3%) moves higher in the wake of the failure of Bristol-Myers' (BMY...

    Onyx Pharmaceuticals (ONXX +4.3%) moves higher in the wake of the failure of Bristol-Myers' (BMY -0.2%) experimental drug brivanib to improve survival in liver cancer patients in a late-stage clinical trial. The result is seen as reducing the competitive risk for ONXX's Nexavar, the only drug approved for liver cancer and a key contributor to the company's revenue and valuation.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:11 PM | 1 Comment
  • MNST

    Hansen Natural (HANS -1.3%) is seeing a bit of selling pressure after Jim Cramer makes some...

    Hansen Natural (HANS -1.3%) is seeing a bit of selling pressure after Jim Cramer makes some unfavorable comments about the energy drink vendor. Technical analysts Cramer consults with aren't fans of Hansen's chart, and Cramer thinks the company's 26x forward P/E is too steep, given Hansen's shaky operating margin and slowing U.S. growth.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:54 PM
  • VMW

    ISI Group reiterates its Buy rating on VMware (VMW +2.9%) with a $110 price target in light of...

    ISI Group reiterates its Buy rating on VMware (VMW +2.9%) with a $110 price target in light of its recent selloff. Investors worry that VMW's best growth has passed, as the company suggests server virtualization penetration rates are approaching ~50%. ISI believes the estimate is conservative and server virtualization growth will remain robust over the next 12-18 months.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:45 PM
  • CAMP

    CalAmp (CAMP -15.6%) gets pummeled after posting FQ3 results. Revenue of $32.8M (+11% Y/Y) was...

    CalAmp (CAMP -15.6%) gets pummeled after posting FQ3 results. Revenue of $32.8M (+11% Y/Y) was in-line with a $30M-$34M guidance range, and EPS of $0.09 was at the high end of a $0.05-$0.09 range. The company is guiding for FQ4 revenue of $34M-$38M and EPS of $0.06-$010, largely better than a consensus of $34.2M and $0.04. Concerns about weakness in CalAmp's satellite hardware business could be affecting shares. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:19 PM
  • NAGS

    Natural gas futures fall off to 27-month lows as revised weather predictions call for "super...

    Natural gas futures fall off to 27-month lows as revised weather predictions call for "super above" normal temperatures for the short-term that will keep demand for heating low. The NAGS natural gas ETF is down 2.4% on the day, and has dropped 21% over the last 3 months.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:48 PM | 1 Comment
  • SD

    Stifel Nicolaus notes while SandRidge's (SD +3.6%) $1B JV with Repsol (OTCQX:REPYY) closes "23%...

    Stifel Nicolaus notes while SandRidge's (SD +3.6%) $1B JV with Repsol (OTCQX:REPYY) closes "23% of [its] coming three-year funding gap," it maintains its Hold rating, "given the volatility in crude oil and the meaningful leverage/cash flow outspend that still exists." But SD still boasts "one of the largest discounts to its underlying asset value," fit for patient investors while it works toward decreasing its funding gap.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:58 PM
  • FORM

    FormFactors (FORM +3.5%) CFO Mike Ludwig adds some more details to the firm's Q4 guidance cut:...

    FormFactors (FORM +3.5%) CFO Mike Ludwig adds some more details to the firm's Q4 guidance cut: "Gross margins though difficult to forecast to be in the range of negative 2% to negative 9%...lower revenues and higher costs will result in a cash burn of $13 million excluding stock repurchases higher than our previous estimate of less than $10 million." (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:29 PM
  • SPWR

    There’s less than meets the eye in SunPower's (SPWR +3.5%) acquisition of Total's (TOT...

    There’s less than meets the eye in SunPower's (SPWR +3.5%) acquisition of Total's (TOT +1.2%) solar subsidiary in return for Total increasing its stake in SunPower to 66%, Liam Denning writes. SPWR's big plus is affirmation that it still has the backing of the huge, French-backed oil major. But TOT would seem to be doubling down on losses from its April buy of a 60% stake in SPWR.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:27 PM
  • EXEL

    Shares of Elelixis (EXEL -3.1%) fall back after the firm files notice (8-K) with the SEC that a...

    Shares of Elelixis (EXEL -3.1%) fall back after the firm files notice (8-K) with the SEC that a development deal with Sanofi (SNY +0.4%) has been terminated.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:18 PM
  • NKE

    The arrival of Nike's (NKE +1.2%) new Air Jordan 11 Retro Concords creates massive lines in...

    The arrival of Nike's (NKE +1.2%) new Air Jordan 11 Retro Concords creates massive lines in stores across the county, as well as some unfortunate breakouts of violence over the iconic sneakers priced at $180. Industry analysts estimate 300K-500K pairs have been produced by Nike in a campaign light on marketing.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:09 PM | 2 Comments
  • RE

    Everest Re (RE +4.8%) offers preliminary estimates of net losses from floods in Thailand...

    Everest Re (RE +4.8%) offers preliminary estimates of net losses from floods in Thailand totaling $100M-$125M, predicated on an estimated industry loss from the disaster of $10B-$15B. With losses at a level where the company should still make a profit in the quarter, shares react positively.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:44 AM
  • EAT

    Brinker (EAT +2.5%) shares may have just reached a 52-week high, but UBS thinks they're going to...

    Brinker (EAT +2.5%) shares may have just reached a 52-week high, but UBS thinks they're going to $30, as the firm raises its price target from $27. UBS finds solid same-store sales momentum at Chili’s, which accounts for ~85% of the casual dining company’s revenue, while reimaging and new ovens will positively impact customer satisfaction and speed of service.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:32 AM
  • SFLY

    Shutterfly (SFLY -5%) shares are swatted after the online photo-sharing site warns of...

    Shutterfly (SFLY -5%) shares are swatted after the online photo-sharing site warns of disappointing Q4 revenue and profit, but Barclays says the cut in outlook was hardly a surprise, and SFLY is still looking at 20% growth in revenue this quarter and next year. "The valuation and recent stock performance have more than factored in today’s downward revision," Barclays says.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:16 AM
  • NYX

    NYSE Euronext (NYX -2.3%) is selling off following downbeat comments from Raymond James, which...

    NYSE Euronext (NYX -2.3%) is selling off following downbeat comments from Raymond James, which expects the company's planned merger with Deutsche Boerse to be blocked by the European Commission. The DOJ gave its approval to the merger yesterday.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:06 AM
  • RMBS

    Rambus (RMBS +15%) is taking off thanks to its licensing deal with Broadcom (BRCM). BWS...

    Rambus (RMBS +15%) is taking off thanks to its licensing deal with Broadcom (BRCM). BWS Financial thinks the deal could generate $40M/year in revenue for the company (all of which would be gross profit), and notes it takes Broadcom out of an ITC dispute Rambus is embroiled in with several chipmakers. Rambus shares were clobbered last month following an adverse ruling in a long-running antitrust suit against Micron and Hynix.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:55 AM
  • AKRX

    Akorn (AKRX +2%) makes new 52-week highs after Deutsche reiterates a Buy on the drug developer....

    Akorn (AKRX +2%) makes new 52-week highs after Deutsche reiterates a Buy on the drug developer. The firm is lifting its estimates following Akorn's acquisition of 3 injectable products, and claims the company's pipeline, expansion efforts, and growth opportunities leave it well-positioned to deliver 30%+ EPS growth over the next 3 years. It also believes Akorn is a potential takeover candidate.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:44 AM
  • MJN

    Mead Johnson (MJN -3.9%) extends losses after Wal-Mart pulled a specific batch of Enfamil...

    Mead Johnson (MJN -3.9%) extends losses after Wal-Mart pulled a specific batch of Enfamil formula yesterday following an infant's death, but analysts say it's important to note that the government did not mandate a recall; it's not even certain there's a link between the infant's formula and the death. Current share weakness likely is an overreaction, CLSA says.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:28 AM | 1 Comment
  • CHS

    Shares of Chico's FAS (CHS +3.8%) shoot higher after dealReporter breaks out with a story that...

    Shares of Chico's FAS (CHS +3.8%) shoot higher after dealReporter breaks out with a story that the company is drawing interest from P-E firms.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:24 AM
  • NOA

    Canadian oil services firm North American Energy Partners (NOA +24.4%) soars after stating it...

    Canadian oil services firm North American Energy Partners (NOA +24.4%) soars after stating it will soon resume operations at a mine owned by Canadian Natural Resources (NYSE:CNQ). However, the company says a "final resolution" of its long-term services contract with Canadian Natural is "still being negotiated."

     
     
     
     
    | 10:18 AM
  • CASC

    Oncothyreon (ONTY -2.1%) trades lower after the firm files (S-3) a shelf registration with the...

    Oncothyreon (ONTY -2.1%) trades lower after the firm files (S-3) a shelf registration with the SEC to sell up to $150M in securities including common stock, preferred shares, debt issues, and warrants.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:56 AM
  • BOX-OLD

    Shares of Seacube Container Leasing (BOX-OLD -3.1%) fall off after the firm files (8-K) a shelf...

    Shares of Seacube Container Leasing (BOX-OLD -3.1%) fall off after the firm files (8-K) a shelf registration statement with the SEC to offer up to $75M in a mix of securities.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:49 AM
  • CBK

    Christopher & Banks (NYSE:CBK) reports FQ3 losses of $0.79/share, wider than a year-ago...

    Christopher & Banks (NYSE:CBK) reports FQ3 losses of $0.79/share, wider than a year-ago $0.26 loss, with revenue rising to $123.9M vs. $120.9M a year ago but gross margin falling to 21.7% from 35.9. CBK expects margin pressures to continue in its FQ4. CBK -2.6% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:06 AM
  • MRK

    Baird initiates coverage on Trius Therapeutics (TSRX) with an Outperform rating and $13 price...

    Baird initiates coverage on Trius Therapeutics (TSRX) with an Outperform rating and $13 price target. Analysts with the firm call the biopharmaceutical a "very high quality company and recently de-risked story" on the strength of its pipeline and position in the MRSA hospital infection market. Shares +10.2% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:01 AM
  • SPWR

    SunPower (NASDAQ:SPWR) acquires Total (NYSE:TOT) subsidiary Tenesol SA for $165.4M concurrent...

    SunPower (NASDAQ:SPWR) acquires Total (NYSE:TOT) subsidiary Tenesol SA for $165.4M concurrent with a deal under which Total agrees to purchase 18.6M shares of SunPower common stock in a private placement at $8.80/share - marking a 50% premium to yesterday's close. After the sale of Tenesol, Total will own close to 66% of SunPower's common stock. Shares of SPWR +26.2% premarket, TOT +2.5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:14 AM
